docTitle.titlePart:
Collision Broadening and Shift of the 535.0 nm Tl Line
Accompanying the Photodissociation of Thallium Iodide
Perturbed by Noble Gases
Part I : Effects due to Rr and Xe.

byline.docAuthor: E. Lisicki, A. Bielski and J. Szudy

titlePage.byline: Institute of Physics , Nicholas Copernicus University, Torun , Poland

front.div:
The shape and shift of the 535.0 nm thallium line resulting from the photodissociation of
thallium iodide perturbed by krypton and xenon were investigated at low densities. The Doppler
and collision broadening components of the line shape have been determined. The linear de-
pendence of both the Lorentzian half-width and the shift on the perturbing gas density was found
and interpreted in terms of Van der Waals and Lennard-Jones potentials.
